description: First attested in 1501; of unknown origin.

entries.meaning: (chiefly Scotland, Northern England) A state of indecision or confusion; a panicked state; a flap, fluster, or dither.

verbs.description: swither (third-person singular simple present swithers, present participle swithering, simple past and past participle swithered)

entries.meaning: (Scotland, Northern England) To be indecisive or in a state of confusion; to dither.
